. @dsturnbull the underlying calculus seems to indicate that the Church-Turing thesis is incomplete, which is even more shocking
@dsturnbull yep. that's the exciting part. this is old news in ruby/lisp/python - doing it in a typed way is slightly shocking.
basically, a really clean solution to the expression problem.
I wanted to say "referential transparency", but it's a slightly different property - means anything that used to run will run the same way.
fascinating talk by Barry Jay at FP-Syd - Bondi adds the ability to extend functions at runtime without losing "behavioural continuity"
@danishkirel what are you trying to do, exactly? I wrote Hubris (http://github.com/mwotton/hubris) to make writing Haskell and Ruby easier.
